description:
Had a wonderful time at Bacco! Came here on a Sunday evening for an extended family dinner. The staff was attentive & the food was fresh, well presented & delicious. We had the lasagna, rigatoni, gnocchi, eggplant, mussels, and meatballs - wow! Everything was so amazing & served in a timely manner. 

The environment was dimly lit & homey/romantic. Will definitely be back & trying different things on the menu, as I bet it'll also be good!
author: Meghan W.

description:
This has to be one of the best Italian restaurants i've ever eaten in San Francisco! I was invited to eat here from working with Shari Dominici at my dealership Audi San Francisco in which she purchased two cars from me with her family so I came to support her local business and try it out! 

I was beyond impressed with the level of comfort and service Shari and her staff provided me with and my best friend Corey. We went with a couple of options she recommended paired with wine and it was decadent. 

I had lovely evening out and this is definitely a place to go to if you haven't done so already! I'm certain i'll be back very soon! Thanks Shari :)!
author: Ron M.

description:
I love Bacco! It's definitely a neighborhood gem in Noe Valley. My favorite dish is the tonnarelli (squid ink pasta), and for dessert, the puff pastry really does it for me. They do have interesting specials most nights, and I'll often go for those. The ambiance is quite relaxed and warm; the decor is equally warm and inviting. 

Also, the wine list is very reasonable. You can get a delicious Italian wine without spending in the three-digit per bottle category.

This restaurant has a special place in my heart. The owner, Shari, helped me with some bread, which is delicious, for my engagement. Shari is a total sweetheart and really cares about her diners.
author: Pascal R.

description: If you're looking for quality Italian in San Francisco you've come to the right place. Freshly made pasta and everything on the menu is incredible. Love this place! Sherri is the best, always so nice and attentive. The lasagna is to die for!
author: Alexandra W.

description:
Not that I've ever been a regular or have a particularly special relationship with Bacco, but I've got to say...it's nice to see that they're still going strong after all of these years!  Although I can't recall what I ate, I still remember coming here when I was a kid with family for a birthday dinner.  Fast forward to just last month and there I was, seated at the same corner table by the window that I sat at so many years ago.  Kind of cool, if I do say so myself...

Located on the far edge of the main drag through Noe Valley, Bacco is practically a staple of the neighborhood.   In business for two decades and counting?  Definitely a sign that they're doing something right, despite the menu showing a bit of its age.  While not exactly dated, their dishes are definitely more classic than innovative.  Not that there's anything wrong with that, but worth mentioning if you're expecting a trendy, Mission-type of spot with dishes doused in truffle oil.

Looking over the menu (appetizers, pastas, and entrees/meats), several things caught my eye, especially their lasagna and gnocchi dishes.  In the end though, from their list of specials, I opted to get the BUCATINI AMERICANA ($21) - Hollow Spaghetti with Onions, Pancetta, and Spicy Tomato Sauce.  Pretty decent overall, but it (literally) left me wanting.  On the one hand, the sauce (albeit sweet) had a nice kick, the pasta was well cooked, and the pancetta was super flavorful.  However, in the other, the portion felt really light for the money.

Food aside, Bacco is a solid spot, particularly if you're looking for something low key.  Service is friendly and parking, much like snagging a table here, isn't terribly difficult compared to other restaurants in the city.  All in all, though they may not have ever amazed me (now or as a kid), Bacco is closer to four stars than three for me.  I'll just have to try to make sure it's not another decade plus before I come back again!
author: Mike L.

description: Came here with a big group for a bridal/groom party before the big day and the staff were very accommodating and sweet. They have an array of wine selections and a very small set menu. For the hefty price, you don't get much in quantity and the quality was definitely lacking. I was not wowed by the pasta dishes that we received and the chicken entree was dry and tasteless. The appetizers were never big enough to share but just for a single person to literally nibble on. However, they do make a great pesto sauce/ dip that they bring out with bread as a small starter. I recommend looking over the menu first to see if they have what you want because there were very minimal substitutions and majority of their pasta is in a tomato based sauce and not a cream sauce.
author: Michael L.

description:
Shari was warm, vivacious and accommodating to our group of 3 from the very start.  She was attentive to my gluten-free needs and made recommendations accordingly (many of the dishes!).  The red wine, orange salad and squid appetizer definitely appetized, then the trio of entrees - grilled branzino, roasted chicken and asparagus risotto - wowed us as we ate 'family style' (Shari's suggestion).  We topped it off with their divine flourless chocolate cake.  All in all, a perfect dinner !!  Bravo, Shari. 
I live in East Bay, but definitely would make this an SF dinner destination!
author: Sharon L.

description:
I had wanted to go to Bacco for quite a while, but it was a bit disappointing. The food wasn't that great, wasn't that bad, just average. Very, very average.

We had two appetizers. The cavolo (sauteed kale) was fine, but kind of bland. The crostino was tasty--but it was so simple, the kind of thing that it bothers me to pay for.

Main course: she got the fregola (Sardinian pasta, clams, mussels, scallops, saffron, fresh tomato). It seemed promising, but it failed to live up to expectations. The sauce was kind of Chef Boyardee-y. I got the risotto, which was actually quite good.

Overall, we felt like we could have made everything at home, and probably better. Having said that: great service and good ambience.
author: Matt C.

description:
Amazing food. Great service. Wonderful setting.
Ps: get the eggplant thing! And the tiramisu as well. Enjoy!!!!!!!!
author: Nicolás A.

description: Bacco is delicious. I almost don't want to write a review, because I'd like to keep this place our little neighborhood secret, but they deserve the praise. Delicious Italian food with great service.
author: Erin D.

description:
We've been here countless numbers of times, but one thing remains true - this place makes me feel happy that I live in San Francisco.

The rigatoni is a holy grail dish. I always get it even though I have the intention of trying something different. I can't resist.

Also Shari is a delight. She remembers us and makes us feel like part of the family. I can't stress how much she contributes to the experience.

Can't wait to come back... again.
author: Marshall Z.

description: Holy Rigatoni!!! The pasta here is incredible. The staff is lovely, hardworking and attentive.
author: jackie r.

description: Amazing Rigatoni and my husband loved the branzino. This is our favorite Italian place in the city. Great owner/host. Cozy.
author: Vicki L.

description: Best meal in all of San Fran! Authentic, fresh ingredients, great service. The octopus appetizer in red wine sauce is amazing in flavors. Many layers of flavor. If you think lasagna is lasagna then I challenge you to order it from here. THE BEST LASAGNA I've Ever Had! The whole table said the same thing. Tomato sauce, béchamel, delicate pasta. Amazing. Sheri the owner comes around and greets everyone, making sure you're taken care of. She is so sweet!
author: Jennifer a.

description: I ate here over the weekend I was thrilled with the experience. The food was fantastic and flavorful, and our waiter was very kind and attentive. I will certainly keep this place in mind when I have guests from out of town.
author: Dierre U.

description: What a great find! The host Shari must be the owner because she is so into the service. Great pasta and thedeserts were so good! Iw ould give it 6 stars if I could. Great local place! Its like being in Italy.
author: Davis M.

description: This lovely neighborhood Italian restaurant was a post-memorial gathering place (right next door to the Church!) with delicious food, welcoming service, and a comfortable setting. They served the best salad, meatball, lasagne buffet followed by a choice of tiramisu or peach tart and coffee. Upon leaving, I checked out the extensive menu, and I plan to return very soon for dinner!  There is also a wine-bar menu to consider. Another Noe Valley gem!
author: Heather H.

description: Best authentic Italian food in Noe valley. I have been going to Bacco since last year when I moved to Noe Valley and I'm never disappointed. The food it's just like it was when I went to Italy, very authentic and consistent every time. The service it's outstanding and the wine selection is very amazing as well. My favorites are the grilled calamari salad ( one of the best in San Francisco) , the grilled branzino (reminds me to the fish I used I used to have for lunch every day when I was in Calabria Italy) , The  moscardini ( tasty tomato based baby octopus stew) also want to mention the rigatoni with red pepper sauce is to dye for.
author: Lidys A.

description: Most delicious Italian food I've had in a while. The wait staff was so nice and were continuously checking in and asking if we needed anything throughout the night. Very romantic and reasonably priced, location is very easy to get to. Will most definitely be back the next time I'm in town.
author: Lexie M.

description:
Good food. 

I wanted to fall in love with this place, but it didn't quite happen. 

The staff were so kind and gracious and it was nice to see so many people out at a local Noe establishment, but we just didn't love the atmosphere or the food all that much. 

Food wise, i got the CROSTINO, the POLPETTE & the SACCHETTO, which were all good, but not amazing.
author: Stephanie M.

description:
Lovely dinner out for Italian. Staff were wonderful, it's fun to sit back and watch them. It's like choreography. Attentive and on it. 

We enjoyed squash soup with Gorgonzola cheese that was a-mazing, Brussels sprouts, chicken with pancetta, and lasagna. Everything was great. 

Great Italian place for dinner, couples, families, all ages. 

Come here. You won't be disappointed.
author: Christine N.

description:
Good food.  Nothing special.  We chose this restaurant because it says it has a lot of gluten-free options.  Given that -- why don't they provide a list of those options?  Instead, the (obviously annoyed and hurried) owner/hostess came over to our table and very quickly rattled off what dishes can be made gluten-free.  She even got a bit huffy when we asked for clarification.  The person in our party who is gluten-intolerant is 90 years old and she couldn't possibly follow that fast (and fairly rude) recitation.  

Service was fairly friendly, but it our waiter is skilled in the "avoiding looking at our table" school of restaurant service, so it took quite an effort to get our check.

With all of the excellent restaurants in SF, and many serving dishes similar to those offered here, it's hard to understand why Bacco doesn't make more of an effort to make its service better.  We won't bother coming back.
author: Gail J.

description:
Magnifico!
Delicious little Italian restaurant!
The red sauce is the perfect consistency with an excellent amount of flavor. Vermicelli noodles were great. The meatballs are small but fantastic. They even made a caprese salad for us when it wasn't on the menu. The staff and manager were flawless, excellent service and very polite. Highly recommend this place even to Italians that get home cooked Italian food at home.
author: Tom P.

description: We came here last Saturday and it was a little weird. I'm disabled and needed a bench seat, so I made a special request reservation and followed it up with a call to confirm when we were on our way over. The hostess stressed that she had a large party coming and we would have to limit our dining time to 90 minutes. I said we'd be right over. When I arrived, she had apparently seated the next guest to arrive in our seat, so we had to wait for them to move. The whole experience was a little weird - the hostess was the only woman on the staff and seemed harried. servers banged down utensils, etc. on the table. Despite the apparent need to get us out of there, we were left unattended for a long time between dinner and dessert, so we cut short the dessert to make our window. The food was decent and the other server was good, so it wasn't a *bad* experience, but I don't think we'll go back.
author: Amy T.

description:
Our party of 4 went to Bacco on Easter Sunday.  Perhaps due to the holiday our experience was negative.  The service was terrible.  We had 4 different servers, one being the owner.  We had to ask for more bread (it is very good) and then got 4 pieces.  When we need more water, I got up to get it as no one was paying any attention to us.  I also got up to get more than 1 copy of the desert menu.
The food- well my pasta bolognase was amazing.  
So I give this place 2 stars, mostly for the food as my dinner mates were happy with their meal.  Oh did I mention that it was $$$$$ super expensive for what we experienced.
author: N G.

description:
I've eaten here at least three times and I've been happy overall.

The atmosphere, service, and especially the pastas are all excellent.

I was disappointed by the wines I've tried here so I'll take a star off for that but that's the only thing I could really find wrong with this spot

If you want a quiet date night spot, this is a good recommendation too.
author: Art O.

description: Warm. Pleasant and welcoming. Bacco is the neighborhood place to go for a nice warm dinner that can run long. Portions are generous, flavors pronounced and the prices are decent. It's louder here when it's busy and you will leave full - almost a little too full as it'll test your self-control. Some of the combinations deviate from the usual.
author: Kevin H.

description:
This is our go-to neighborhood restaurant.  The service is lovely, pasta is made from scratch and the atmosphere is romantic yet lively.

We usually get the calamari, walnut ravioli and tiramisu.
author: Adam H.

description: We went here on recommendation from a local we met at The Dubliner. Food was great, we had the gnocchi and another pasta dish that escapes my memory. Quiet atmosphere on a weeknight.
author: Cat B.

description:
The Rigatoni was amazing...  The California Cab by the glass was also outstanding for the price point.    

The service was on point and extremely friendly.   The Rigatoni was so good we got another order to go our son at home.  This is a great find and we will certainly be back...  Thank you again for a great experience.
author: Seth T.

description: Came here for Christmas Eve. Great ambiance and awesome food. Recommend ink pasta and mussels.
author: Chen C.

description: Came for a quiet birthday dinner for two. Making reservations was quick and easy, which is sometimes hard to do in this city. Was seated swiftly and taken to a corner table that suited us perfectly. They have an extensive menu and also a menu of specials to choose from. We started with the impepata, clams and mussels in tomato sauce, which was fairly good. The mussels were huge and juicy but i actually thought the clams were the highlight of that dish. I ordered the pasta special for the evening which consisted of fettuccine pasta with porcini mushrooms and prawns. It was very rich and fairly tasty. However I don't know if I'd order it again. A bit too rich for my particular taste. My friend ordered the vermicelli, badically spaghetti and metlatballs. A classic which you can't go wrong with. We ordered the lemon crostata for dessert. Wasn't a highlight for me. A bit dry and not very lemony. But the service and ambiance were wonderful so i would definitely come back for a nice dinner if I were in the neighborhood.
author: Jane P.

description: Delicious pasta. Nice ambiance. Perfect for a date. I would definitely come back again.
author: Jun N.

description: Tonight we started off with the beet salad and mussels with clams. Both were delicious. The clams were tasty with a tomato based sauce and the beets were sweet with orange and goat cheese. My husband and I shared the Fregola and braised ribs. The ribs had a ragu with gnocchi and had a rich flavor and the ribs were extremely fall off the bone tender. fregola was tasty with lots of seafood. My favorite desert is the apple tart with Carmel and ice cream. Everything was delicious and spot on. I frequent Bacco often when I'm in town. One of my go to Italian restaurants.
author: holly z.

description:
Everything here at this local joint is great.  Start with the owner, Shari, to the food.  This place is kid/family friendly and food is really good.   Beet, Bacco or Caesar salads are delish.  Most appetizers we've tried are tasty. Our fave is the rigatoni but all other pasta we tried are excellent as well.  Pls support this local gem!

Went again and still really good.  The octopus salad (special today) was especially deli she!
author: Dkac C.

description: Excellent. It was recommended highly to me by a friend and was therefore I was eager to be more "experimental" with my food. Got the salted cod with polenta (unique and tasty)  squid ink pasta and it was great, I ate the whole thing. Many wine choices. Tiramisu was tasty, not the best I've ever had. Ambiance is romantic and good for small groups as well.
author: Arpita S.

description:
Great local Italian eatery, excellent friendly service and consistent Italian food. Love this pace, great for families. 
Ciao Bella
author: Mark N.

description: been going there for years and had mixed experiences, went there last week I am glad they may had change the cook everything was pretty much on target according to my wife that lived for years in Italy, nice wine list and EXELLENT SERVICE BY MARIO  we had fun practicing our Italian ! Only feedback to give is that my salmon cauliflower soup was not as hot as I would like it to be, the temperature was just too low :( and I would suggest to the hostess lady to "tone it down a little" she could be kind too intense or even intimidating  for some ....
author: Viktor-Olena V.

description:
My review is based on Valentine's Day menü.

I really enjoyed Valentine's Day here. The bread was awesome (CARBSSSSS). They served it with a pesto oil. (GET IN MY MOUTH).

I had a glass of white wine

For app my boyfriend and I both had a lobster bisque with shimp on it. Very amazingly seasoned. 
For entrees my boyfriend had muscles wrapped in a sole (with cheese of sorts) and rice. Fantastic.
I had a veggie pasta they made special for me with tons of mushrooms!!
For dessert it was a chocolate cake with white chocolate. The chef put strawberry shaped syrup in the white chocolate. 
$65/person. 

I would LOVE to come back for the regular menu and try the gnocchi. My favourite!
author: Amanda M.

description:
I've been to Bacco many times over the past few years, and every dining experience has been so enjoyable.  It's all about the food, ambiance, wine pairings, friendly neighborhood feel, and almost more importantly the loving owner and her staff that take the utmost care of you.  

On my most recent dining experience this week, I called the night before asking if there might be a special risotto favorite of mine on the menu, and it wasn't.  To my absolute surprise, Shari (Owner/Manager) greeted me at the door the next day at our reservation time to let me know that she picked that special ingredient up for me and I was beyond impressed!

The meatball starters and raviolis are special favorites of mine, but I always want to get the risotto!

I highly recommend Bacco for people searching for great authentic Italian food and a very intimate dining atmosphere.
author: Eric R.

description: This was our second time visting Bacco and still as impressive as the first time we ate here. The atmosphere is great, two hours flew bye. We had the rissoto and the beef short ribs and both dishes were outstanding! We also ordered a half bottle of wine and a full bottle both italian and extremely delicious! This place is now our top favorite restaurant. Service is amazing and very helpful. The owner who is running around is great she definitely adds a great  vibe to the place. This is a five star in my book!
author: Crystal M.

description:
The food is to die for delicious! Everything we had, the squid, the meatballs, the pasta, the drinks, the food is just amazing. 

The place is a bit crampy and claustrophobic for me, but nothing a little wine can't make me forget about. Its nestled in a great little side street in Noe Valley and even though the front door is a bit strange almost came off the hinges in my husband's hands when he went to open it, the inside of the restaurant was neat and clean  (albeit VERY dark). 

I would DEFINITELY suggest trying BACCO. We got to meet the owner Sheri and she was a delight. She was also very sweet. 

Only one issue with our food the entire evening. When my husband went to have a bite of his gelato for dessert, he took a bite and ended up with a gigantic piece of plastic in this mouth. The server stated it was probably the plastic piece off of the container for the ice cream. 

They DIDNT even take the dessert off of the bill. Ummm..... that was VERY strange.
author: Tanya C.

description: This is now my favorite Italian restaurant!!! My girlfriend is Italian (from Italy) and she said that the lasagne is as good as her mom's (the best in the world)! Everything is amazing including the ravioli and the polenta with whipped cod! The owner is super sweet and attentive too.
author: Kenneth G.

description: Very nice and friendly staff got us right into a table on a friday night. Has a very neighborhood local feel. Great restaurant overall. Delicious unusual Italian dishes with a relaxed yet classy ambience, with a very charming friendly hostess.
author: Madeline F.

description:
Great service. It felt like an authentic Italian restaurant with the service alone. 

The wine was delicious. We ordered one of their Chiantis. 

We started with the octopus (delicious), beet salad and eggplant crostini. All yummy. 

They brought really fresh bread for the table with a homemade pesto oil to dip in. They kept replenishing the bread without us ever asking - the way it should be :)

My friends all ordered a different pasta dish and they were all so good. I wasn't too hungry so I opted for the orange salad which was small but had so much flavor. 

I'll definitely be coming back here for great pasta, wine, and service.
author: Laura D.

description: Great dinner as usual. Food was polished and flavor could not be beat. The atmosphere is always date worthy with the exception that depending where you sit it can be loud. We usually try at least one of the listed specials. Go go go..
author: Frank S.

description:
Lovely spot for a Sunday night candlelight date. The neighborhood is quiet and cute, the interior is spacious with some more private seating and dim lighting, and the food and service are very good.

Thumbs up for the meatballs in tomato sauce, squid, squid ink pasta, filet, and dessert.
author: Paulina F.

description: One of my favorite spots in SF. I confidently found that the authenticity was unquestionable and very delicious. Another comment here mentioned octopus, which I had as an appetizer.
author: Duncan S.

description:
Hubby and I came here for dinner on a week day. The place quickly got busy after 7pm. We ordered 1) beet orange salad, 2) squid ink pasta, 3) lasagna. And the winner was.... The complimentary bread and its dip made from pesto sauce olive oil! So sad, isn't it? The beet salad was sooooo mediocre that I can totally make a better version at home. My hubby hated the squid ink pasta. It's so bland. And the tomato sauce didn't go well with the taste of ink pasta. The corners of the pasta sheet on my Lasagna was burned. I don't recall that's an authentic approach when I tried Lasagna in Italy. I guess the chef didn't cook the pasta sheets with enough liquid/ricotta mixture when the dish was baked in the oven. It's such an amateur's mistake. 
So what's for the 2 stars? We did enjoy the ambient and the bread dip. Ok to bring your date to Bacco, but stay away if you and your date are serious foodies!
author: Shaz L.

description: Quaint Italian spot in the Castro. I have Celiac, so came to try out their gluten-free items and their was plenty to choose from on the menu (salads, pasta, etc.) I got the rigatoni sub GF penne and it was amazing. Would recommend for anyone looking for GF.  Didnt feel bad the next day!
author: Kendrick G.

description:
I came on a Saturday night around 8pm and the restaurant was full. They had one table left so we managed to squeeze 5 people onto one table.

The complimentary bread and olive oil was surprisingly average since this place seems really upscale. The bread came cold, which I thought was a fluke, but the second batch was also cold.

I ordered the lasagna and it was the best lasagna I've ever eaten. First, the size of it was impressive compared to my friend's noodle dishes. Second, there were so many layers and the pasta was super soft. Most of the time, lasagna I've eaten tastes like it's been over baked so the pasta has hardened, but they baked it just perfect.
author: Edward W.

description: The best customer service in town and the delicious food and wine were just the bonus!  The staff make you feel like they've known you for years and the owner even walked us out and thanked us for coming in!  Who does that in this city these days?!  The food and waitstaff were so authentic it really gives you an Italian vacation vibe.  We left completely relaxed and oh so happy.  It really did feel like we just had a mini Italian vacation!
author: Shawna K.

description:
If you're veggie, stick with the bruschetta app, go for the veggie ravioli, and skip dessert.

Solid place.

That simple:)
author: Gabriela W.

description: One of the hidden gems of San Francisco! Great service, great food always.  Fabulous wine list and the bruschetta, rigatoni, and desserts are perfect!  Great for date night or an outing with the family.  I have been going here for over 20 years now and have always been served with the upmost care! 100% recommend this to anyone who lives or visits San Francisco!
author: Mara G.

description: One of the best Italian restaurants in the city. Very good food and fresh too. The woman who runs the place is also helpful and charming. Highly recommend
author: Dan K.

description:
This is a little local gem in Diamond Heights.  My wife and I love the tomato sauce used in the pastas.  The lasagna was excellent too.  The flavor is distinct and to our liking.  We've been here several times and consistent each time in terms of food and service.  

The Asian hostess really makes you feel at home. The sun was in our eyes and because the shade were broken, she then went to tape paper on the window to reduce the glare.
author: Keith W.

description:
Second time We've been here this year and they've run out of food on a prefixed menu again. It's hard enough to pick from a few choices, but when they run out of dishes even then it's irritating. On top of that having your food come out almost an hour late adds to it. And the waiter tells you they weren't prepare for a rush on Valentine's Day. Hmmmm. I would think that such a popular place would have been. 
The food was good. And our server was nice on the plus.
author: Satish P.

description:
Ristorante Bacco is a 98 pt. rated Noe Valley institution for the last 23 years and is not to be missed. Check out their new WINE BAR, which offers a fun alternative to standard table seating and I hear they'll soon offer WINE and FLIGHT CLUBS and special Club Member Events to feature their broad and impressive WINE LIST of glasses and bottles to enjoy onsite and to take home. 

Their rating is the result of owner Shari's insistence on consistently renovating/updating the environment to provide a top-notch, super clean (from the bathroom to the kitchen and dining room) and soothing, dining experience. I've lived nearby for 21 of their 23 years and have enjoyed the incredible quality and consistency of their delicious starters, salads, home made bread, entrees and vini over the years. Their food is definitely high quality, modern versions of authentic Italian fare featuring the Bay Area's best quality ingredients that also inspire exciting seasonal treats. What's more impressive is the outstanding service that filters straight down from Shari's sincere warmth, kindness and desire to provide every customer a truly un-rushed, relaxing and satisfying dining experience you rarely get to enjoy in today's insanely rushed world. 

Bacco has that casual, warm, family feel, while still providing a stellar, current dining experience.Their Beet Salad and Insalato Bacco, delicious meatballs, stuffed, grilled calamari and seasonal Crostino (fava bean puree) are Antipasti faves. All of their Primi/Pastas/Risotto are incredible, but my faves are their Rigatoni (a mainstay throughout their 23 years) is hard to pass. When I do, their Squid Ink pasta, vermicelli with meat balls and Sacchetto are not to be missed. Top these off with their fab Primi of which I always enjoy their special fish dishes, veal scallopine, pork & steak entrees, all of which are served with fresh veggies, which is perfect! The perfect sides are their Brussel sprouts and Sauteed kale/spinach which are outstanding.

Lastly, every great meal needs the perfect sweet treat to finish things off. Having lived in Italy, travelled the world extensively and with many native Italian friends, I try every Tiramisu I can get my hands on there, throughout the EU, Australia, New Zealand, Canada and here in the US. Hands down, BACCO HAS THE ABSOLUTE BEST TIRAMISU you'll ever have. 

Gluten Free: Bacco offers numerous Gluten Free options and even provides Gluten Free bread on request so Shari's GF clients won't have to miss their faves. 

While many longtime San Francisco business owners are being forced out of SF, Shari gives new - longtime customers many reasons to return time and again and every reason to support this super-special, single mom, woman-owned San Francisco institution, Ristorante Bacco and Wine Bar.
author: Marc S.

description:
Came here in a group of 8 and we had a great time.   The wine was delicious, the food was really good, and we were the last group to leave around 11 pm on a Saturday but the restaurant manager and staff didn't make us feel unwelcome.  (Granted they did start vacuuming around 10:30/10:45 pm which was a bit of a hint).   

For appetizers, the beet salad was decent, and the crostini (eggplant mousse, burrata, candied hazelnut) was delicious.  The antipasti platter came with a tomato bruschetta, shredded crab crostini, calamari/white bean combo, prosciutto and various grilled veggies.  We could probable have passed on this dish.  

For entrees, we loved the braised beef short ribs which came highly recommended by our server.   Others really enjoyed the gnocchi as well.   

Overall it was a really good meal.
author: Vivian W.

description: Bacco was a wonderful holiday dinner during our recent vacation in San Francisco. The dining room is small and intimate, but there was certainly room for larger groups should the need arise. We were served by an owner or manager (unclear which) but she took herself and her food seriously, while also taking some time to be personable with my date and me. We both had pasta dishes and shared the fish special and side vegetables. Everything was tasty and the value was great, one star deducted for pasta that wasn't as fresh or inventive as it could've been. Still overall delicious and a wonderful dinner date.
author: Kameron V.

description: Randomly landed to this amazing little jewel restaurant in the middle of Noe Valley. Chef Vincenzo is outstanding!! Got best Sicilian food in years, super authentic fresh sea food in Mediterranean sauce!! Trust me: I am Sicilian! Host Shari was super kind and incredibly attentive! Atmosphere is gracious, very pleasant, elegant but not formal! Highly recommended!!!
author: Scuba D.

description: Great food. Great service. And super cozy ambiance! Shari (owner) runs an awesome show here!
author: Merlino T.

description: This is a great authentic Italian restaurant in Noe. Prices are a little high for Italian food, but the quality is superb. I had the seafood pasta and my gf had the braised short ribs with gnocchi. They were both quality dishes that I would definitely get again. They have a wide selection of apps and main courses. The size of the plates are generous. The wine by the glass was more expensive than most restaurants as well, but it's still worth it. I will be back.
author: Jorge S.

description:
Poor service and mediocre food.  I made reservations via Open Table for a Saturday night for a party of 7. We arrived on time and it appeared that they were not aware of the reservation.   We had to wait 30 minutes to be seated. While waiting for our table, I noticed that the wait staff was unorganized.   There was a lot of running around and barking of orders.

Once seated, the service was just as chaotic--while the waiter came by shortly after we were seated to inform us of the specials, it was another 15 minutes before he came back to take our orders. I had to ask for the wine list,  the bread and water were practically dumped on our table. My father and husband both ordered the catch of the day,  and then were told that they had just ran out of it. My daughter ordered the risotto and was served brasato instead.   She had to wait another 15 minutes to get her meal while the rest of us ate ours. While our table was being cleared of the antipasti dishes,  one of the waitstaff toppled over my son's glass of red wine. It was replaced promptly.  The food was good--not bad. Nothing really stood out.  We probably would have enjoyed it more if the service made us feel welcomed and relaxed. 

With all of the other dining options in Noe Valley, I don't intend on coming back to Bacco.
author: Florlina A.

description: We walked there tonight arriving at 8:35 pm for dinner. We had heard great things, we're looking forward to it after a long day at work. Their hours said they close at 9:30.  As soon as we walk in to the restaurant, which has at least 5 tables occupied and waiting for food, the owner/manager walks up and says the kitchen is closed. We remind her of the time, their posted hours on their website and she says I'm sorry there's not enough business to keep the kitchen open. We left and will never return to an establishment with no interest in serving customers.
author: Pri C.

description: Wow - there aren't even words to describe how much I loved my dinner here.  The risotto special for the night was Dungeness crab and they piled the crab gently on top of the amazing risotto.  My husband had the braised short ribs over gnocchi and the gnocchi were like soft pillows. The wine list and wines were outstanding, I had a delicious sparkling rose and insolia, a sicilian white wine. We wrapped up with the flourless chocolate cake, a tiramisu and an espresso. The waiter was Italian, and added so much to the ambiance. I loved this place and will definitely return.
author: Christine V.

description:
For some of the best Italian food in The City outside of North Beach, head over to Ristorante Bacco.

Ristorante Bacco is not your father's red and white checked tablecloth Italian joint.  Rather, with muted tones and a peaceful setting, it provides an upscale, but comfortable, elegant dining experience.

The menu has something for everyone, from omnivores and vegeterrorists to the gluten-free crowd.  Tender and moist, the calamari served on a bed on cannellini beans and topped with fresh arugula ($12) was grilled to perfection.  The creaminess of local goat cheese and the acidity of the honey citrus dressing were perfect foils for sweetness of the beets in the barbarbietole (beet salad, $12).  Cooked perfectly al dente, the housemade pasta and succulent coniglio (rabbit, $24) was delicious.  Lightly sautéed in olive oil, the cavolo (black kale, $9) was complemented by just the right amount of garlic. And, oh the bread!! By and large Italian bread is uber-crunchy and painfully dry.  Not so at Ristorante Bacco.  The bread was fresh and soft and delicious--so tasty that the contents of the first basket disappeared all too rapidly.

An autentica cameriere italiano (authentic Italian waiter) provides excellent service.  The servers define attentiveness:  the water jug was never empty and wine glasses were barely set down before another glass was proffered. The staff are very knowledgeable about the menu and wine list, stopping to understand diners' preferences and providing good recommendations.  The good-sized and reasonably priced wine list exclusively features Italian selections, and there are ample offerings by the glass to complement any dish on the menu.

Upon dining at Ristorante Bacco, you will understand why it is one of only three Italian restaurants in San Francisco to receive the Marchio Ospitalita Italiana, an award that distinguishes those restaurants with the highest quality of Italian hospitality.
author: CJ G.

description: Came here Sunday evening ~ had great food and the ambiance was good! The only downfall was the horrible service! Waiters blatantly ignored us and didn't tend to us once. Would only come back if these issues were fixed
author: Duke Of Frisco X.

description: The service was very good and so was the food (especially Rigatoni) but for the price that it was I would rather go to another place.
author: Rylan C.

description: Amazing food in a fantastic area of San Francisco. Twice, I have brought my friends from the Chicago area here and they were absolutely impressed by the food and service. The Lasagna, Rigatoni, and Tonnarelli were delicious and the atmosphere was lively, yet not over-bearing. The prices were very fair, and I would absolutely recommend this restaurant to any Italian or fine dining enthusiast in the San Francisco area.
author: Joshua N.

description: I love Bacco! I have going there for the past 20 years. It is amazing how Sherry and Vincenzo are able to consistently deliver excellent Italian food every time. The wine list is amazing. I have learned so much about Italian wine from this restaurant. The risotto is always prepared to order, so it takes about 20 minutes. The gnocchi are also made to order with special gnocchi potatoes. If they have cannoli beans with tomato sauce, don't miss.
author: Chuck H.

description:
I came here recently with a friend for Dine About Town.  We were greeted fairly quick and shown to a pretty small table for 2.
To start off, I really liked the bread with the pesto olive oil.  Thinking about it, it was the best out of my meal.  
From the choices, I picked the Salted Cod on grilled polento as the appetizer.  While it had an interesting taste and texture, it was too heavy for me as a starter.  My main entree was the fish of the day, which was Cod with white wine and lemon capers.  The cod was really bland while the sauce had a strong vinegar taste, but I couldn't taste any lemons.  I was really disappointed with my fish, in the end I was dipping the cod in my friend's steak balsamic sauce to get some flavors.  On the other hand, the vegetables and potatoes that came with the fish was actually pretty good tasting.  For dessert I ordered the tiramisu which was fairly good, but a bit too much cream and not enough espresso or rum flavor for me.
Maybe I should have ordered something different instead?  My friend enjoyed her meal and I did enjoy her steak dish.  Not sure if I want to come back.
author: Karen L.

description: I figured I'd try Bacco yet again - if anything it has gotten a bit worse.  The service was below average as they were understaffed, the food was just OK, and the restaurant is starting to show it's age, with dirty menus, chipping paint and a dirty bathroom.  I won't be hurrying back.
author: Adam H.

description: Went here for a romantic anniversary dinner with my husband. The food was so good and they offered lots of gluten free options! We will definitely be back.
author: Christie A.

description: Went here a couple months back.  All in all, a great experience.  Some of the apps were misfires but the pastas were excellent.  Great, cozy ambience and solid service.  Definitely in the neighborhood gem category.
author: Saminda W.

description:
I never realized that this restaurant was here until I looked up restaurant suggestions in the Noe Valley area on Yelp. This place is only a 3 block walk from my Aunt's house.  She said that the last time she had dined at this restaurant was over 20 yrs ago. The major difference she immediately noticed upon entering the establishment was how loud the place was compared to 20 yrs ago. Apparently this use to be a very quaint and quiet restaurant.  Tonight, the customers who were inside dining were all pretty loud. We kind of did have to yell across the table a couple of times during our dinner because it was difficult hearing eachother.

Other than the noise level,  everything else about the restaurant was pretty darn good.  We started with the prosciutto with organic cantaloupe.  It was soooooooo good! The cantaloupe was extremely sweet and juicy and the thin slices of prosciutto complimented it very well. For our entrees, I ordered the gnocchi with mozzarella and basil and my Aunt ordered the squid ink pasta with calamari. Both were absolutely delicious!  I was a pig and finished my entire dish. My Aunt ended up bringing half of her order home because she wasn't an oinker like me =oP
And in all fairness, the portions were on the generous side.

For my first time dining at this establishment,  I have nothing but good things to say. The waitstaff was attentive and friendly, the buser was spot on and worked like clockwork. And the hostess was very nice and welcoming.  My Aunt and I had a wonderful dinner at Bacco and I'm sure we'll be back in the near future to try some of their other tasty dishes.
author: Vindy C.

description:
Food: 4.5/5
Price: $$$
Portion: 4/5
Appearance: 3.5/5
Presentation of food: 4/5
OVERALL: 4/5

Came here for Valentines with my husband and we had their pre-fix menu. Which was great, Appetizer, Entree, and Dessert.
I chose...
- Arugula salad with dried cranberries and Ricotta cheese wrapped in prosciutto
- Bolognese Duck pasta
- Chocolate cake (which was the only option)

The salad was superb! Light and balanced. The cheese is soft and not overbearing, the prosciutto gives it a soft textured with a hint of saltiness. The pops of dried cranberries sweetens everything out since the arugula itself is a little on the bitter side.

Main course bolognese with the shredded pieces of tender moist duck with thinly sliced mushroom was all good together. To top it off the pasta itself was a semi wavy thick noodle type, that (I'm pretty sure was purchased from next door's fresh Italian ingredients) was practically hand made!

Only dish I was not impressed was the chocolate cake. It was way too intense in chocolateness, I mean don't get me wrong, I am a chocolate person. But this is so dense in chocolate to the point its bitter. I only took two bites and I couldn't do it anymore, I'm the type that hates to waste food ESPECIALLY when it comes to DESSERT.
author: Eva H.

description:
I came here for my birthday celebration with family. Our table had clams, ravioli, 2 types of veal, and braised short ribs. We also had the tiramisu, affogato, and the sfogliatina for dessert. All of the food was pretty good. The waiter and hostess/owner were very friendly and attentitive.

I personally feel it's a little difficult to find a place appropriate for a family dinner like this because most of the nicer restaurants in the city are catered towards a younger dating crowd. This restaurant is located in a more residential area which probably helps contribute to the diverse groups of diners which included a family with older children, a couple, and an older, possibly retired group of friends. The mix of groups made me feel this was the perfect choice. I noticed a smaller side room as well which would probably work well for diners looking for a more private romantic experience.
author: Jay K.

description:
Wow!  Food is fantastic - Sautéed Calamari appetizer light and tasty!
Handmade pasta is the real thing.
Nice ambiance in Noe Valley.
Waitstaff friendly, competent and service was excellent, and the owner is a gem!
Bacco is the place to go for delicious food, relaxed atmosphere and a wonderful experience.
author: frank l.

description: I got a quick reservation on a Saturday night at 7:30 (which is pretty much unheard of at any worthy restaurant in SF) but I was craving some house made pasta noodles so we tried it. So here's the scoop-Nice intimate restaurant good for small party's, good standard fresh pasta dishes with simple ingredients, the wait staff was the main issue. Our waiter was zipping around the restaurant making it a little uncomfortable and then he forgot our side dish followed by taking forever to give us our bill.  When I reminded him, he made some lame excuse instead of just owning.  Restaurant has potential but just doesn't quite cut it.
author: Leslie S.

description:
For someone who has been gluten-free since 1987, I must say this place has outstanding GF pasta.  

I had the gluten-free TAGLIOLINI and it was extremely delicious! Great texture for gluten-free pasta. 

I took my family out for my dad's 63rd birthday and we split a wonderful Chianti recommended by the waitor, and my dad mentioned it was the best SCALLOPINE he had ever eaten.

Highly recommended!
author: Brooke N.

description: Everything that chef bobby makes is absolutely amazing!!! Every time I come I try something different!! The fish is amazing and fresh every single day! They have amazing fish you have never heard of and no tilapia or salmon !! The filet is huge! The pasta is mouth watering! The whipped cod, octopus, calamari, clams and melt in your mouth meat ball appetizers are to die for!!! Even the fresh homemade bread is delicious!!! baccos has become My favorite restaurant!!!!! The staff is very attentive and the owner is always walking around checking on you!! Even the wine options are great!!!!!!
author: Shauna P.

description:
We're so lucky to have Bacco in Noe Valley.  Their authentic Italian food is such a treat.  I normally order food for pick-up (take-out).  

The Sacchetto is perhaps my favorite.  It's a unique signature dish with a pasta pillow filled with vegetables, and if you don't love the sauce, something may be wrong with you. :)   But the Rigatoni and Brasato (melting braised short rib) are also favorites as is the Barbietole (goat cheese and beet salad) for starter.

Can't recommend this place enough.  I'm heading there now and my stomach is growling.
author: Geek F.

description:
For months I had been dreaming about coming to this charming restaurant. Maybe it was the anticipation, but the food was just meh. Very bland and reminded my of chain restaurants. For the price, the food quality is just not there. 

The service was just OK. They "lost" our reservation. All the servers were running around. They tried to create a local feel by asking our names and chatting us up, but they kept forgetting my name so it just felt inauthentic.

I would have given the place a two-star review, but I will say the TIRAMISU is out of this world good.
author: Megan V.

description: Some of the best Italian food I have ever had in San Francisco. Shari puts on a great dining experience with incredible food to support it. This gem is a must try. You wont regret it.
author: Caitlin K.

description: This is a good one. Food is great (bread is fantastic). Service is typically on point. Candle lit tables create a relaxing atmosphere.
author: Greg S.

description:
I'm a sucker for Italian places that pretend like they recognize you when you come in. 

This place is our go to for taking parents from out of town and they're surprisingly kid friendly. Great, hearty pasta dishes and nice appetizers like the meatballs and calamari (not the fried kind). 

I'm grateful that the place is usually able to seat us this without much of a wait but a little surprised that doesn't get more attention.
author: Baron C.

description:
Truly excellent gluten free pasta. Perfectly cooked, delicious sauces, and actual selection. Couldn't ask for anymore. I had the rigatoni, which was unbelievably good and my girlfriend had the tagliolini, also excellent, both with the gluten free penne - awesome. 

In addition to the food the service was amazing. Rafael made us feel very welcomed, was very well informed about the menu and especially the gluten free options, and was a lot of fun to talk with. 

Just go.
author: Michael C.

description: Top 5 Italian restaurant...been in biz for 25 yrs (I think) which for a restaurant is almost unheard of...mostly homemade pasta
author: Nima E.

description:
This was the perfect spot for my gluten free birthday!! Gabriel was awesome!! He gave the best service, best advice on food and was all around FABULOUS for the entire dinner!!! 

When I called asking about gluten free items, the hostess and owner (a lady who's name I can't remember but she was also incredibly helpful) enthusiastically told me about the options. Usually restaurants give me attitude over my food allergies or have no idea what they're talking about, potentially making me sick. 

The gluten free options are GOOD and QUALITY. Didn't feel like I was missing out on any authenticity. They order their gluten free pasta from Italy! You can't get it in the US!

For my birthday they made all of us feel like very comfortable. Food was wonderful and they all went to great lengths to make me feel special. I didn't feel like a rock star. I felt like family. Thanks guys, I really lucked out choosing your restaurant. The night was perfect.
author: Brandileigha S.

description: My favorite Italian restaurant in Noe Valley ! Always fine cuisine and nice people! I will be back soon, for sure
author: Grégoire D.

description:
We went to Ristorante Bacco because a gluten-free friend in our group had read Yelp reviews that suggested there would be lots for her to order. We were seated quickly at a lovely corner table overlooking the street. Our waiter was a bit rude and hasty, and was pushing us to order. The GF member of our group asked if they had any of the gluten-free bread that she read about on Yelp--they didn't. Apparently they have cut their GF menu items significantly because it was hard to keep non-GF food and GF foods separate in the kitchen. She was so bummed! 

I ordered the butternut squash gnocchi and it was very tasty! We also loved the panna cotta for dessert. The place has a lovely atmosphere and is reasonably priced for the quality, but is not as GF friendly as suggested.
author: Erin F.

description: Three of us booked for the special dinner celebrating Bacco's 23 years in Noe Valley.  It was a three course meal showcasing dishes and wines from the Marche region of Italy.  We had a wonderful evening. The food was excellent and the delicious wines complemented the food perfectly.  Service was warm and friendly and the whole occassiosion memorable.  We know from past experience that we can rely on Bacco for a good night out, but this evening was a cut above the usual. The only reason I have not awarded five stars is the the very pleasant dining room is very noisy and, although we booked several days ahead for the set menu dinner, it was 45 minutes before our first course arrived.  But, overall, a great experience which we hope to repeat again soon.
author: Jenny M.

description:
I heard rave reviews for the gluten intolerant and so I thought I'd give it a try. 

I was not overwhelmed. The food was "ok." The wine was "ok.' Our service was "ok." Basically, it was "ok." 

There were some things on the menu that were gluten free but our waiter seemed annoyed at having to point them out to me. He seemed to have to be somewhere else every moment he attended to us. Rushed. Hasty. Those are good words. Whenever I tried to make eye contact, he was busy looking at the other things going on in the restaurant. The hostess, who seated us, seemed to be kind of in the same mode. She tossed us our menus, which spun around on the table. Seemed very... flippant. It's funny how the service at the start can set you on a path of mediocre for the entire meal. 

I had the Radicchio salad which was very good - nice dressing, arugula, Gorgonzola and pecans. Sweet and sour balanced and it was tasty. I then had the filet over potatoes and greens. All of the vegetables were really fresh, well cooked, and the beef was actually done very well. Perfectly cooked. The pasta special with lamb was, in the words of my partner, "ok." I'm seeing a trend...

We had dessert - I had the flour-less chocolate cake and he had the puff pastry with apples. His was, in his words, really good. Mine was... ok. It didn't really pack a punch. 

Overall, the food was good but nothing made my mouth say "wow" or "that was amazing." It was, really, "ok." The service probably made me drop it down a star. I was hoping for a really good experience and somewhere I could go back to with my little gluten-free heart. Alas, I would go again but I wouldn't be really expecting much.
author: Kris S.

description:
Came here last night for dinner with a group of 5. Seated quickly with water and bread out fast. The olive oil pesto ish dip was tasted great. 

Had two glasses of cab, and ordered the beef tenderloin with truffle sauce. I by far ordered the superior dish, as others were just ok. I had my dish prepared medium rare and it tasted superb. I was debating if this was a 3 or 4 star place, but since my meal was great, and the service was great. Cant go wrong with a 4. Little pricey though.
author: Benjamin B.

description:
EDIT 12/18/2013: I was contacted by the owner, Shari, because she felt bad that I didn't enjoy my meal. I have to say, this was a lovely interaction and it's nice to know that Bocca cares about its customers. I could tell that this is more than a job to her and it is personal when someone has a bad experience. Shari said that she refuses to let people have a bad experience because when people come into Bocca, "it's like they're coming into my home." She mentioned that she had the chef remake the same dish I had ordered, and she agreed that there wasn't enough truffle on the dish. Overall, she made me feel good about the whole thing and it is really wonderful to see businesses with owners that genuinely care.

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------


After taking a semester of Italian, it really had me craving Italian food. I'm usually wary of neighborhood restaurants because people usually like them for reasons other than the food. They usually like the convenience, how kid-friendly a place is, etc. I thought I'd give Bacco a shot tonight, because I really wanted some fresh pasta with careful ingredients, but instead had a terribly mediocre, just really awful pasta dinner at Bacco. 

The pasta special was a linguine with pancetta, egg, pecorino, and shaved black truffles for $35. The pasta was not hot, sort of lukewarm, and a little bit too al dente (although, it's better than it being mushy and overcooked), there was too much cooking water that had transferred over, making the dish watery and not creamy whatsoever. I make carbonara at home several times a month, so I know the technique of adding egg to the pasta and stirring before it has time to cook and it ends up being a lovely creamy texture, but that didn't happen in this case. The pasta was really lacking SALT and the fat from the pancetta wasn't rendered out enough. All of this for $35. To add more insult, the truffle was no where to be found. I could see little black shavings, but couldn't taste them or smell them. What's the point if it doesn't add anything to the flavor of the dish?!

The squid ink pasta was slightly better, but still extremely mediocre. At $20 for one plate, you think it would be more exquisite, but the sauce was very bland, lacking depth of flavor. The pasta was nicely cooked, so that's one good thing I can say, but as I was eating,  I kept thinking "what am I going to eat for dinner when I get home?" The service was okay and professional and the bread was decent when it was first served warm, but it got a bit weird as it cooled off. Also, the pesto-type sauce they served with it had the same problem of being too watery. 

I feel pretty insulted after my meal here and know I won't be back even though I live in the neighborhood. This is just another one of those neighborhood joints that is resoundingly disappointing especially for the price.
author: Victoria J.

description: Bacco is one of our favorite Italian restaurants in the city and is consistently good each time we come. My favorite dish is the tonnorelli , a squid ink pasta. It's made with fresh homemade pasta cooked al dente in a delicious red sauce with calamari. The dish is simple but oh so delicious. We also tried the meatballs which were made just right, the meat was moist and subtle and the sauce..it was just mouthwatering. The bread is also made fresh in house and comes with a pesto and olive oil dipping sauce.  The service is impeccable the woman that always greets us (I think she is the manager) is very outgoing and friendly.  The ambiance is romantic, candlelight, small and intimate setting. Perfect for a date night!
author: Victoria N.

description:
Sis had received some bad news so a last minute dinner spot was needed to drown away all our worries.....enter Bacco

The waitstaff couldn't have been friendlier & we had a great bottle of wine at our table before we knew it - then the deliciousness really began

Starters included Squash Soup for the bf - it was made w/ chicken stock ( veggies beware! ) & he said it was thick & creamy & all kinds of good

Sis & I shared the Buratta & it was a nice creamy bloop of mozz on a crispy toast round w/ sundried tomato jam - scrumptious!

Entrees included

BF - pasta with clams, mussels, & scallops in tomato / saffron sauce - he said the pasta was cooked perfectly & the seafood was a nice variety & a lot of it

Sis got the Gnocchi w/ basil, tomato & scamorza -- she's a huge fan of the red sauce paired w/ her gnocchi & the little pillows were firm, a bit chewy & had a great texture

I opted for the special of Squash Ravioli - this was a combo of Squash & Artichokes & it was light, just a bit pumpkinny-sweet yet & tart from the chokes

Tiramisu for the table to finish off the meal & by that time, we were well stuffed & laughing the night away.....mission "fun night" accomplished!
author: Adrienne G.

description: Was looking for a nice restaurant to celebrate my hubby's birthday and found this gem that is actually a neighborhood restaurant with financial district quality!!! I was worried whether they remembered it was my hubby's birthday, but sure enough his dessert came out with a candle on it and the server started singing! So sweet! Loved my ink pasta and surprised with my orange salad and my hubby enjoyed his lasagna, especially the sauce! His Apple pastry was freshly made- wow! Well worth the wait!
author: Darlene B.

description:
My partner and I went to Bacco for our Friday date night based on previous Yelp reviews.

The restaurant has a very cozy atmosphere/very at home feel.
We were greeted by the host right as we walked in the door even though it was very busy. We were immediately sat and asked for our drink order, the wine selection is great here! 

We were given the perfect amount of time to decide on what we wanted to order, we asked for recommendations between items and the server was happy to oblige:) 
Our first course was out quickly followed by the perfect entrée! All food was just brilliant! Down to the amazing tiramisu! 

At the end of the evening the bill is brought in a top hat, just a great little touch to the end of the evening! 

I would recommend trying this place! Bacco will have you addicted! Plan on going back soon!:)
author: Charles B.

description: I have been here a couple of times with my boss, who is been a regular for years, and he never has to twist my arm to go. Very pleasant and spacious restaurant (tables are spaced pretty far apart), good service, very good food, nice wine list, and well-priced for a restaurant of this type. Street parking is usually not a problem. A good option when going to the Castro Theater (if you don't want to drive, and don't feel like climbing the steep hills, the Divisadero bus will get you pretty close).
author: Jethro B.

description:
Bacco's ambiance is perfect for dates. There were several happening nearby our table and everyone seemed to be in their own world enjoying their wines and company. Including yours truly. 

Next time I'll opt for the smaller portions. The larger portion was a bit much for me and judging from the reactions of those around us when they got their dishes they were thinking the exact same thing. We were stuffed and had to skip dessert.

I had the Sacchetti which was great however I had plate envy of the gal who had the risotto (my favorite!) next to us. 

Overall service was quick, efficient with a nice, low-key ambiance. As a (new-ish) resident of Noe I'm sure I'll be back. I just have to keep in mind to keep the complimentary bread consumption at a minimum next time. We were both SO full from dinner I think we rolled back to the car!
author: Esther A.

description: So delicious romantic.felt like I was in Italy and they offer gluten free pasta!!! so yummy, can not wait to go back!!!!
author: Kimmy C.

description:
Im a sucker for pasta~

Bacco is a cute Italian restaurant located in Noe Valley. Came in at 6.45 pm(rush hour!) and seated via Open table. Waited a couple of minutes and was seated overlooking the outside(they have a big glass window). We ordered for appetizer:
-calamari
-moscardini(baby octopus) 

I liked it. The calamari was soft enough that its not chewy like leather and the moscardini had a good flavor with the red wine and tomato sauce. For the entree, i got the:

-Tonarelli(squid ink pasta)

The pasta was cooked al dente, the sauce was good and the portion was just right. The only criticism that i would have to give would probably be that i needed more salt! But hey, i think thats just my taste bud so it wasnt a big deal for me. Service was good too, waiter always came by to ask about my food, and drinks were always filled up. But i guess, if i have to say something, they do make me wait for a while to get my order and bill....but ill let that go considering it was a saturday night. 

For desserts:

-LA PANNA COTTA ALLE CIGLIEGE(buttermilk panna cotta)
-LA CROSTATA DI LIMONI(lemon curd butter crust)

absolutely my favorite combo for desserts. The lemon curd is actually pretty sweet, maybe a little too sweet for me, since i like the taste of lemon more in my lemon curd. But i adore the panna cotta, so butter-y and milky, so good. 

I think overall, i had a pretty good time here. Sure there are some minor tweaks that the restaurants can do to improve the service and food, but i dont mind coming here again when i am in the area.
author: Cavin T.

description:
I made a last minute reservation for a party of 3 on a Sunday night for 8:15PM. When we got to the restaurant, our waiter seemed less than pleased to greet us and tell us of the specials and whatnot. Probably  because they could have closed at 9:00PM but I'll never know forsure..

Bacco Salad [http://s3-media4.px.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/fYhoPYKy-8gGi-ROIL9wFw/l.jpg]
Coming from a true carnivore, this salad was pretty good. Big bites of [REAL] bacon, quail eggs, cheese crumbles, and walnuts. Oh, and the salad with a nice vinaigrette , of course! 

Polpette (Slow Braised Meatballs) [http://s3-media1.px.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/h51mmSsh-qzBtEhTxcWtlQ/l.jpg]
Our second appetizer, but this one was a disappointment. For $12, you get only three bite-size meatballs and despite being "homemade and slowly braised", it tasted like any other regular meatball.. blah.

Maiale (Center Cut Bone-in Pork Chop) [http://s3-media3.px.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/YFC568fdW-XyoXybMTjPBg/l.jpg]
My mouth was watering when I read this on the menu, but again, it was a miss. It was Pistachio crusted on a bed of greens and paired with a nice smooth and lumpy mash potatoes, but the porkchop itself was overcooked and dry. Perhaps it was because all our entree's came out at the same time, but it just didn't work out. 

Tiramisu [http://s3-media3.px.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/XH5FIh_GvcX4_J2uj0WIvw/l.jpg] [http://s3-media2.px.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/UZ5wk5qy36xMuEeNxe_Pfg/l.jpg]
Really, I'm a sucker for tiramisu and with that being said, I've eaten a ton of tiramisu in my day to say that Bacco's was forgettable. It looked very unorganized with the ladyfingers and insides oozing out. Of course, it was still good, but I definitely had better. 


The food was either a hit or a miss. The highlight of the meal was my girlfriend's Handmade Penne Pasta dish, which was delicious! The service was a tad slow and felt rushed, but it was a Sunday evening after all, and we didn't see that waiter that "greeted" us when we got there by the end of the night (probably jetted home). The madame also comped one of our desserts (Ganesh Cookies [http://s3-media2.px.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/RhSgVdxfPH0NKV7D_jeDTQ/l.jpg]), which we didn't really enjoy, so that was very much appreciated. 

I'll definitely have a second go at Ristorante Bacco in the future.
author: Albert L.

description:
I have been here twice. Once in 2012 and once last week. Both times I had a reservation and both times I walked in and was ignored for 2-5 minutes despite the waitstaff walking by several times. I guess only the distracted hostess can acknowledge the customers. 
Gnocchi and tube pasta were fine, nothing extraordinary. Portions were good and not overpriced. 
I live close by so maybe i'd go back, wouldn't commute for this place.
author: Lizzie R.

description:
Cute SF-like decor. I really liked their bread and the pesto olive oil. We ordered grilled squid as an appetizer, which is served with white beans and arugula in olive oil. The squid was very tender. I ordered Sardinian pasta with clams, and baby scallops. It was my first time to try this Sardinian pasta which is much like couscous. I would prefer linguini over sardinian but the flavor of the dish was really good and the food came out really hot, like right out of the pan, which is a huge plus! My bf ordered vermicelli and meatballs. This was even better! The service was very good as well, and our waters kept being refilled every 10 minutes. 

They have THE best panna cotta. I order panna cotta everywhere I go, and this place is one of the best I've had. The texture is solid but not too creamy and rich, and I could taste a little lemon and vanilla in it. Mmmmm. The only part I didn't like is that it is served with cherry sauce along with sweetened black cherries.
author: Cartman P.

description: First and last time here. Service was excellent. Atmosphere very nice. Food not so good. Short rib gnocchi was too salty. Seafood dish was also too salty. Didn't finish short ribs because of the salt issue, asked for some plain pasta to go with it to take home.....a half order of rigatoni.....plain rigatoni was $9.00!!!!  Give me a break!  I had an Italian restaurant myself for 15 years, I know that's way overpriced!!  And a sure way to lose a repeat customer. It was an opportunity for them to make a loyal customer. Lost now.
author: Reggie Q.

description: We moved to this neighborhood and have been exploring the area. What a gem is this place! A rustic and lovely Italian, super friendly staff and just so welcoming even with young children. They don't usually do lunches unless it's for 20+ special events worth looking into as restaurants with this much room is a bit hard to find in Noe. We are now coming here on a weekly basis and this has become our favorite place. Everything is great, but highly recommend the meatball spaghetti! The wine list has great reasonably priced Italian wines, too!
author: Chiharu T.

description: Delicious farfalle with rabbit ragu and panna cotta for dessert. Fabulous.
author: Chris T.

description:
We went there with a large party (6 adults and 2 kids) for a last minute reservation.  The team there could not be any more accomodating.  Then the food started coming and we were all so pleased.  I had not been back to Bacco in years so really I was just expecting a nice neighborhood experience, but wow, the quality and the flavors rival any high end Italian fare.  Every dish was superb, the wine suggestions were spot on, the kids were happy with their offerings and the adults were over the moon for their food. 
So a huge two thumbs up for Bacco..for sure will be back time and time again!
author: Olga E.

description:
Really great Italian dishes and excellent service in a quiet, friendly setting. 

My wife had the tonnarelli (squid ink pasta) and I had the sacchetti (large vegetable stuffed pasta) and both were spectacular; this may be the best pasta we've had in San Francisco. Their pasta is homemade, made fresh, and served al dente. We started with some sauteed kale and octopus; both were perfect; the kale was flavorful and not too firm or soft, and the octopus was tender and in a nice sauce. To finish we had the buttermilk pannacotta served with cherry compote, and it was wonderful; the real taste of buttermilk with homemade marinated cherries. 

Everything is made by hand by people that understand and care about making Italian food the right way. My wife is an Italian food fanatic (we're talking cooking classes in Bologna, 80-year old Balsamic vinegar from Modena, ice cream making classes from Carpigiani) and she loves the food here. I do too.
author: Gangi I.

description:
Hubby and I made a last minute reservations on a Saturday night and got in at 6:30pm.  By the time we left, the restaurant was filled.  Because of the last minute we sat next to a divider with little ambiance.  The staff was excellent and constantly meeting our needs.

We started with an appetizer of a small plate of the Rettangoli ,l a delicious ravioli with a puree sauce of eggplant, goat cheese, and zucchini.  Next we had salads.
My Barbabietole with oranges,beets, and goat cheese was very good.  My husband's Bacco salad with nuts, Gorgonzola, a boiled egg was also very good.  We only wish they had prepared with a little more dressing and ingredients.

My main course was a small plate of the house made spaghetti with meatball.  I am not an expert of pasta sauce, but I thought it was not very exciting.  The homemade meatball was excellent.  Hubby's seafood with pasta was very good.

You must make room for dessert.  My flourless La torta di Isabella chocolate cake served on a bed of cream sauce (creme Anglaise) was excellent.  We also had the apple pastry with caramel sauce and ice cream.  Also excellent.

We plan to come back and may reservations for the main dining room.

Ciao!
author: Rose J.

description:
Once you hit the millennial mark on Yelp reviews, everything you do afterward seems anticlimactic, doesn't it? I mean who celebrates a 1,100th review. Well, I thought I'd mark this less than monumental occasion by sharing an especially nice dining experience I had at a restaurant that's been around for quite a while but has just been touched by tragedy. 

Bacco is the sort of out-of-the-way Italian eatery that you hope lands in your neighborhood but never seems to. Noe Valley, however, is rife with such places, and truthfully, my friend Maggie and I were thinking about going to Firefly up the block on 24th Street. Because they had an hour wait, we decided to trundle back down the slight hill to Bacco where we were greeted with open arms. 

Now Maggie and I were aware that the owner had been in the news. Sadly, he had gone missing on a fishing trip in Hawaii, so we speculated the staff would be desultory. Not at all. The service was warm and personable. There wasn't the slightest clue of the ongoing heartbreak they must have been feeling. I have to admit I got so immersed in the appetizing menu that I wasn't thinking about it. Everything we ordered was a blessing to the taste buds. They seem to stick with the items they do well and not really change them. A smart approach indeed. 

Maggie went for the $11 Crostino, which consisted of two wedges of bread crostini covered in a chopped broccoli rabe an amazing fava bean puree and topped with shaved pecorina cheese and truffle oil (see my photo). A knockout. I ordered the $12 Pan-Seared Stuffed Calamari, three pieces filled with a cannellini bean puree and all lying on a small bed of radicchio (see my photo). It was a different take on squid that tasted fresh and hearty. 

For the entree, I went for the $18 plate of Pappardelle, obviously homemade pasta which was prepared perfectly al dente and nicely turned in a light tomato lamb sauce (see my photo). Maggie had the $18 Tonnarelli, also perfectly al dente but thin noodles. Hers was mixed with good-sized seared wild prawns, baby artichokes and fresh tomatoes (see my photo). Lovely. We shared a satisfying side contorni dish, the $8 Bietola, which was Swiss chard liberally blended with extra-virgin olive oil, garlic shavings and bits of hot peppers (see my photo). 

We had to try one of their desserts since they advertised them as homemade. Their $8 Tiramisu is among the best I've ever tasted, and yes, I've been to Italy a number of times. Just slightly chilled, it was the ideal combination of ladyfingers, espresso, rum, and mascarpone cheese, all sprinkled with a nice cocoa (see my photo). Maggie and I were so pleased with our meal, but it did strike me to hit the Web that night to see if there was an update on owner Paolo Dominici. 

They had found his remains earlier that day. I just want to express my deepest sympathies to the Dominici family for their loss and applaud them for the unyielding quality in both food and service during such a trying time. There is a note from the family on their web site in the "About" section.

FOOD - 5 stars...Italian as buono as if you were in Roma
AMBIANCE - 4.5 stars...a nice open space with Italianate touches in a nice, quiet neighborhood
SERVICE - 5 stars...stellar under tragic circumstances
TOTAL - 5 stars...Bacco will carry on...
author: Ed U.

description:
Seriously I've been going here almost every month or so as long as I have the money to spend. It's worth every penny.

Brief Summary
-- Still the BEST Italian I've ever had in my life
-- Awesome customer service and wait staff
-- Pasta made fresh daily

Just came here again for another outstanding dinner with my GF and her Mom. You can order anything on the menu and it's going to be delicious.

This time I ordered the Rigatoni, one of my favorites. Great meaty taste. The sauce wasn't overbearing. The tomatoes didn't take over in taste. Portions are plenty enough and you're satisfied when you leave.

GF had the Vermicelli with meatballs and it was delicious. The meatballs are very tender and tasty. They aren't hard like other meatballs that I've had before. 

GF's Mom got what seemed like a seafood medley of clams, scallops and mussels with linguine. She enjoyed it.

We ended the night with the Apple Tart and it was delicious, warm and fresh. You've got to try it.
author: Daniel D.

description: This restaurant is pretty decent. They have several menus; daily specials, set menu, and regular menu. I was looking at all their menus and they all look very appealing (very hard to choose). We ordered the grill calamari/squid and it turned out very different from other calamaris that we normally eat at restaurants. It reminded me of the Japanese style grilled whole squid but this one is juicy and with sauce maybe because it's served on top of salad and I actually like it. The tomato with bruschetta was really good. Too bad there's only 3 in one order. When it came to the entrees my friend and I was indecisive since everything on the menu sounds like a good option so we had the server pick for us. We had the beaded veal and also the stuffed pasta. The beaded veal is very different. Its served with veggies, cheese, and prosciutto and they put the battered veal on top. It's really unique but the veal is a bit dry maybe because of the batter. The stuffed pasta reminded me of lasagna since after cutting open the pasta, it's somewhat in layers and is very cheesy. I love the sauce and would order this again. The pasta is really fresh and I love it but it's really filling. The server and I believe the owner gave us a complimentary tiramisu and it's really good. I'm not a sweet tooth and I normal don't eat sweets but their tiramisu is just right; not too sweet. I can taste the rum. I love their service; very friendly and welcoming. I would definitely come back and try other items on their menu.
author: Cindy W.

description: Best Italian in Noe Valley. A little bit upscale but still casual. Great food. Nice neighborhood location off 24th street so you don't see as much traffic. I would bring people from out of town here for a nice meal. One of my favorite in the neighborhood.
author: David H.

description:
Was here for a dinner date with my husband, and we chose it because of good reviews on Yelp.

**Food: 5 star - We ordered a crab meat tomato sauce pasta, cheese risotto, a side of black kale, and a veal dish. Each dish was incredibly tasty, and we enjoyed every bite of it. 
**Service: 5 star - our waiter was very friendly and accommodating. We felt comfortable.
**Atmosphere: 4 star - A great spot for a date night! We would appreciate a bit more intricate decor, but nothing wrong with what they already have there.

All in all, it's a wonderful Italian restaurant, and we would certainly go back.
author: Jane M.

description: Food here is fantastic, as is the ambiance and staff. Really a lovely experience overall. We go there all the time because it's so great!
author: Susan L.

description:
This restaurant has been in Noe Valley for 20 years and has been fantastic all through the years. Its a neighborhood gem. The food is real Italian . They have a great wine list and I love all their Italian reds that they offer. if you get headaches from Reds try an Italian red you wont get a headache!
 Its small so make sure you make reservations. Be sure to save room for dessert. The service is wonderful. Great for a romantic dinner or a girl friends catch up. The staff lets you enjoy your food without  trying to rush you out the door like some other places. Try some delicious home made pasta with wild boar is my favorite and a classic Barolo wine. The pasta dishes can come appetizer size or full size which is great so you can try more food!
author: Angela G.

description:
